text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with potato gnocchi or gun yaki as
it's supposed to be pronounced in
Italian I had one potato and I said I'm
gonna make a really small batch of
gnocchi so I put it in the microwave for
I don't know who was about seven minutes
for me until it was cooked nice and dry
it's okay to microwave it stop making
that face all right and now probably the
most important part I need to have this
potato really totally granular so I'm
going to push it through a strainer just
with the back of a wooden spoon and
that's going to separate all those
little grains of potato without mashing
it and that really is the key to the
texture of like a really good gnocchi so
I push through all the potato
none of the skin of course I'm going to
add a nice big pinch of salt I got to
leave that out on the table for about 15
minutes to cool otherwise it's going to
scramble the egg I'm going to dump in
one beaten egg by the way you can easily
double this recipe of course I'm going
to mix in the egg with the tines of a
fork and I'm going to put in about about
a third of a cup of flour I'm just going
to use my fork to just work it in there
nice and gently now I don't like my
gnocchi to pasta like I prefer like
almost like a potato dumpling so I'm
just going to mix enough flour in to
make this into the shape I want so once
I do that I'm going to add another pinch
I'm going to move to a spatula and with
the spatula I can kind of tell how dough
like it's getting and right there just
started to hold together and I knew I
was very close all right I'm going to go
in with my fingers another shake of
flour and that I can tell just by
feeling alright is going to hold
together and you really got to go by
feel if you've never made gnocchi before
good luck with that so I needed that
just for like maybe 10 seconds I'm going
to form it into like a log I'm going to
cut that in four pieces and then we got
to make what they call the snake so you
gently roll it on the board with your
fingertips you start in the center and
as you roll you roll to the outside and
it gets longer and longer and then you
stop
because it's perfect it's about a half
inch thick and that's it I'm going to
cut these in little half inch slices
that way I don't really like a giant
yaki
I prefer small ones but that's up to you
then to make the little ridges on them
and this is very hard to show describe
and show in slow motion because you
really do it much faster than this but
what you do is you take one of those
pieces and you just kind of roll it on
the back of a fork and it makes those
little ridges and you don't even have to
do this really but what happens is those
little ridges when it cooks they say it
helps hold the sauce which I guess is
true again it's very hard to show I
don't have the best equipment for
close-ups but that's it just roll it so
you can do that or not do that I don't
think it's like a huge factor but that
is the traditional look with a little
ridges all right I'm going to get my
sauce ready I'm just going to use a nice
spicy tomato sauce I'm going to bring
some salted water to a boil I'm going to
dump in my gnocchi and how you know
they're done here's how they're going to
float after about I don't know 30
seconds after they come to the top
you're going to cook for exactly 14
seconds and then you're going to pull
them out with a strainer like object and
you're going to dump them in your sauce
and you're going to toss them in the hot
sauce and they're ready to eat and you
can see all those little ridges that's
going to kind of grab on to the sauce
and that looks pretty darn good so these
are really quick simple potato gnocchi
not a complicated recipe great way to
use up if you have one odd potato I have
for whatever reason had one potato
sitting in the bottom of the bin and I
figured hey let's make some gnocchi I
prefer these as a first course or as an
appetizer just a small amount like that
I don't really enjoy a whole giant plate
of them but that's up to you so this
batch with one potato you're going to
get about four appetizers or two main
courses all right serve it very simply
with some grated Reggiano parmesan and
that's it we're done anyway I hope you
give these a try they're fun to make go
to the site get the ingredients and as
always enjoy
